nl.esciencecenter.neon.shaders

Class ShaderProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.esciencecenter.neon.shaders.ShaderProgram

  • public class ShaderProgram
extends Object
    This library's interpretation of a Shader program. Different formats for shader source inclusion are possible (files, strings). Shader programs can be constructed consisting of vertex shader and fragment shader, and an optional geometry shader. Shader Programs made with this class have an internal storage for GLSL uniform variables, and perform checks on use to see if these variables have been set by the user via the setUniform methods. The typical/correct lifecycle of a ShaderProgram is: 
      
 1. Create, @see ShaderProgramLoader
 2. Init
 
 while(displayCycle) { 
   3. Set Uniforms
   4. Link attributes / Vertex Buffer Object, @see VertexBufferObject
   5. Use
 }
 
 6. delete
    Author:
    Maarten van Meersbergen

      • use

        public void use(javax.media.opengl.GL3 gl)
         throws UninitializedException
        use method for this shader. sets this shader as the current rendering shader and loads all staged uniform variables. Also checks for the presence of all uniforms and checks for additional opengl errors.
        Parameters:
        gl - The opengl instance.
        Throws:
        UninitializedException - if this ShaderProgram was used without initialization.

      • linkAttribs

        Parameters:
        gl - The opengl instance.
        attribs - The list of attributes to link.
        Throws:

      • setUniformVector

        public void setUniformVector(String name,
                    FloatVector var)
        Staging method for a Uniform Float Vector variable. This will be given to the GPU upon use(GL3 gl) of this ShaderProgram.
        Parameters:
        name - The name in the GLSL code for this uniform variable.
        var - The Vector to stage.

      • passUniformVec

        public void passUniformVec(javax.media.opengl.GL3 gl,
                  String pointerNameInShader,
                  FloatBuffer var)
        Method used to pass uniform variables directly to the shader without staging them beforehand. Using this method to set shader variables interferes directly with the error checking code present in this class. Use is not recommended. Use setUniformVector(String, FloatVector) instead.
        Parameters:
        gl - The OpenGL instance.
        pointerNameInShader - The name in the GLSL code for this uniform variable.
        var - The uniform variable to pas to the shader.
